result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick J. Eppolite Jr.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 08:15 am.

State appears by ADA Kerri Puig. Atty Dan Cveykus appears in person on behalf of Deft. Atty Oren Jakobson appears by phone on behalf of Deft. 
Parties request plea/sentencing hearing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Patrick J. Eppolite Jr.
Current: 166004 Junction Road, Wausau, WI 54403 United States  (Effective: 09-26-2022)
Prior: Dodge Correctional Institution, PO BOX 661, Waupun, WI 53963 United States
Pre-trial conference on October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Case Called:1:45 pm
INCLUDES 18CF957, 20CF346, 20CF1175, 21CF128, 21CF1421, 21CF1532, 22CF87, 22CF408, 22CF409.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig in person. Defendant appears in custody, in person, and with Atty Dan Cveykus and Atty Oren Jakobson in person.
VRCW.
Court addresses the parties; Court notes that he has previously recused himself of a case from 2013 and has no recollection of the file. 
Court will not recuse on these files. 
Parties are requesting a Pretrial Conference to discuss the files. 
Atty Jakobson states that there was a Speedy Trial Demand on 22CF408 and 22CF409 previously, and Defendant has not retracted that demand. 
Atty Jakobson makes arguments regarding bond. ADA Puig makes statements. 
Court Converts Bonds to Signature Bonds; Atty Jakobson is withdrawing the Speedy Trial Demand due to the bonds being converted to a signature bond.

DATES:
Future dates to be set with the JA-
PTC, FPT, JSH, JT 

Adjourned: 1:47 pm
Review hearing on September 26, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Patrick J. Eppolite Jr.
Current: Dodge Correctional Institution, PO BOX 661, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 07-20-2022)
Prior: 166004 Junction Rd, Wausau, WI 54403
Status conference on August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Clerk: Heather.
Case Called: 10:06 a.m. 
INCLUDES: 18CF957, 20CF346, 20CF1175, 21CF128, 21CF1421, 21CF1532, 22CF87, 22CF408, 22CF409. 
State appears by ADA Alex Lech,. Defendant appears in person from MCJ with Atty Dan Cveykus and Atty Oren Jakobson.
VRCW. 

ADA Lech notes defense has offer and discovery.
Atty Jakobson indicates there has been confusion re: speedy trial and bond.
ADA Lech stipulates to amending the bond.
ADA Cveykus objects to the suggested bond modification.
Atty Cveykus notes there has not been a prelim on 21CF1421.
ADA Lech requests a 2 day trial in 22CF408.

DATES:
CC: 7/19/22 @ 1:00 p.m. (to set JT in 22CF408 prior to December 2022)
PH: 7/20/22 @ 9:30 a.m. (21CF1421)

Adjourned: 10:14 a.m.
Final pre-trial on July 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
ADA Lech appears; Atty Rick Cveykus and Atty Oren Jakobson appear for deft; Atty Jakobson withdraws speedy trial demand and will file letter with court; FPT/TPD set;

Clerk: Heather.
Case Called: 3:33 p.m. 
INCLUDES: 18CF957, 20CF346, 20CF1175, 21CF128, 21CF1421, 21CF1532, 22CF87, 22CF408, 22CF409. 
State appears by ADA Alex Lech in person. Defendant appears from MCJ with Atty Rick Cveykus and Atty Oren Jakobson.
VRCW.

ADA Lech indicates Defendant has been transferred to Dodge, requests a special hearing next week to see if resolution has been made.
Atty Jakobson is requesting a JSH right before JT, notes 22CF408 and 22CF409 are the cases being heard at trial.
Parties to discuss setting future dates at PTC next week.

DATES to remain.

Adjourned: 3:37 p.m.

Final pre-trial on May 23, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury Trial on June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
ADA Lech appears; Atty Rick Cveykus appears in person; Atty Oren Jakobson appears via phone; Parties discuss case; Negotiations will continue;
